alert.note: Alert for Hudspeth (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Texas, including the following county, Hudspeth. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Minor flooding may also occur along Interstate 10 between mile markers 115 and 135. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Mineral Creek and Red Light Draw. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Allamoore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are numerous of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
